block.p: Aislinn Weidele and Jeffery F. Klier were married last evening at City Hall, a restaurant in New York. Judge Arlene Hahn of New York City Housing Court officiated.

The bride, 38, is keeping her name. She is a graphic designer at Polshek Partnership Architects in New York. She graduated from the University of Maryland and received a Master of Fine Arts in sculpture from Queens College.
Aislinn Weidele and Jeffery F. Klier were married last evening at City Hall, a restaurant in New York. Judge Arlene Hahn of New York City Housing Court officiated.

The bride, 38, is keeping her name. She is a graphic designer at Polshek Partnership Architects in New York. She graduated from the University of Maryland and received a Master of Fine Arts in sculpture from Queens College.
She is the daughter of Roxanne Fern Weidele and Bruce Allen Weidele of Galesville, Md.

The bridegroom, 42, is a funeral director at Riverside Memorial Chapel in New York. He graduated from the University of California, Santa Barbara, and received a degree from the American Academy McAllister Institute of Funeral Service.
He is the son of Donna Lee Silva of Payette, Idaho, and Waldemar Sidney Klier of Castro Valley, Calif.
